In addition to helping patients in our local community, we allow both our staff and doctors the opportunity to participate in short term medical mission trips to impoverished countries. ORGANIZATION
The mission of Ravenswood Family Health Network (RFHN) is to improve the health of the community by providing culturally sensitive, integrated primary and preventative health care to all, regardless of ability to pay or immigration status, and collaborating with community partners to address the social determinants of health.
POSITION SUMMARY
Under General Direction, implements Ravenswood Family Health Network’s mission, philosophy, and goals across all activities. Delivers comprehensive primary eye care commensurate with optometry degree, privileging, and State of California scope of practice, using evidence based high quality care and patient centered health home (PCHH). Works with other providers to define best clinical practices and with the care team to deliver care under established protocols. Provides comprehensive eye care that includes diagnostic and rehabilitative procedures necessary for the treatment of refractive anomalies, complex visual anomalies, ocular diseases and manifestations of systemic diseases. Works with team and health center to collect data and review reports to improve care and for achieving and maintaining PCHH and Meaningful Use (MU). Champions customer service and quality improvement. Maintains a professional atmosphere that respects patients and staff.

To be performed in accordance with RFHN Policies and Procedures

It is the mission of Mobile Medical Support to maintain and improve the health of seniors by providing comprehensive Audiology, Dental, Podiatry, and Vision care. We are looking for an exceptional person to join our Vision team! The Optometrist is the face of the entire Vision department to their patients at nursing facilities, independent living facilities, and the PACE program. Job Title: PT Optometrist - Doylestown Pa: Flexible days/hours

Doylestown Family Eye Associates is a single lane medical optometry practice located in the heart of Bucks County, Pa. We have a fully integrated EMR system, Cirrus OCT, Zeiss Fundus photography, VF perimeter, an in-house lens edger and a full staff in place. We see about 15-20 patients per day and schedule every half hour. No weekends required and complete flexibility in terms of working M-Th and/or some combination. Docs will only see patients - no contact lens fittings, no billing, etc. It is a professional yet casual environment with a wonderful surrouding community.
We are family first here so it is the perfect place for someone looking to be part of a professional, award winning team (full time or part time) but also have a full home and social life. Come see Doylestown Family Eye Associates!!

About Our Practice
General Optical Company is a family owned company that was started in 1953. We made safety glasses for General Motors and other local plants in Genesee County. As time went by an Optometrist and Dispensary was added to the practice. Plus, we still have a full service lab to accommodate our patients.
We have grown to three locations in beautiful Genesee County. We still have our original location in Downtown Flint, location in Burton, and a location in Fenton. Our Optometrist occasionally rotate between offices to cover doctor absences, but usually have a main store that they work. Since the demographics for each location vary, there is the opportunity to see patients with all sorts of eye conditions.

Company Description
About Us:
Our practice is looking for a dedicated Optometrist with strong diagnostic skills and a passion for delivering a great patient experience. Our Optometrists are comprehensive primary eye care specialists. They see patients with a wide variety of pathology and refractive needs and often catch systemic issues. We believe they are the hero of primary eye care.
Our goal is to create a team of Doctors who can do their best work, be fulfilled, and know they are contributing to work that really matters: helping people experience life more clearly. We remove the complexities of practice management with a support team of trained optical professionals including optometric technicians, opticians, contact lens technicians, receptionists, and management staff.

PRIMARY PURPOSE
Optometrists provide comprehensive vision care to patients of all ages. This includes, but is not limited to prescribing, coordinating and dispensing eyeglasses. Optometrists coordinate the care of chronic eye conditions, needed annual screenings and acute eye care needs. At Lorain County Health & Dentistry, optometrists are expected to develop long term relationships with their patients and their patient’s caregiver, provide patient informed individualized healthcare recommendations and plans and offer ongoing support and advice as needed in accordance with Lorain County Health & Dentistry’s philosophy of “partnership” with patients while integrating its values of Respect, Quality, Compassion and Hope.

POSITION SUMMARY: The Optometrist willprovide quality eye care and emergency treatment to Hometown (HHC) patients. The primary focus will be to examine eyes and visual system, diagnose problems or impairments, prescribe corrective lenses, and provide treatment. May prescribe therapeutic drugs to treat specific eye conditions. The optometrist will collaborate with HHC providers and support staff.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES
1. Perform vision tests, analyze results and develop a treatment plan
2. Examine eyes, using observation, instruments and pharmaceutical agents, to determine visual acuity and perception, focus and coordination and to diagnose diseases and other abnormalities such as glaucoma or color blindness.
3. Prescribe eyeglasses, contact lenses, and medications

POSITION SUMMARY: The Optometrist willprovide quality eye care and emergency treatment to Hometown (HHC) patients. The primary focus will be to examine eyes and visual system, diagnose problems or impairments, prescribe corrective lenses, and provide treatment. May prescribe therapeutic drugs to treat specific eye conditions. The optometrist will collaborate with HHC providers and support staff.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES
1. Perform vision tests, analyze results and develop a treatment plan
2. Examine eyes, using observation, instruments and pharmaceutical agents, to determine visual acuity and perception, focus and coordination and to diagnose diseases and other abnormalities such as glaucoma or color blindness.
3. Prescribe eyeglasses, contact lenses, and medications

Job Title: Optometrist: Give the Gift of Sight Both at Home and Abroad
Job Description:
Dr. Presley & Associates is a thriving optometry practice located in Tulsa and Sand Springs, Oklahoma. In recent years, we have experienced tremendous growth, thus we’re currently looking for an optometrist to help provide visual and eye health care to our patients. The schedule is very flexible and could consist of 2 to 5 days a week. This is a great opportunity to work with a knowledgeable staff as well as a dedicated scribe in a professional environment. This allows the Dr. to focus on patient care rather than data entry.
Dr. Presley & Associates is a fast paced environment, located next to Eyemart Express. We see approx. 30 patients per day and provide our doctors with compensation well above the Oklahoma average. In addition to helping patients in our local community, we allow both our staff and doctors the opportunity to participate in short term medical mission trips to impoverished countries. Over the past 3 years we’ve provided eye care and glasses to over 6,000 people in Kenya, Colombia and Ecuador.

Albany Area Primary Health Care, Inc. develops partnerships with our patients in the context of family and community. As a part of our commitment to providing quality care we are currently looking to expand our optometry team! Operating an integrated care model to our patients also offers a unique practice environment for our providers and allows them to go beyond the typical office environment and actually see patients where they are. AAPHC offers a competitive benefits package including health and dental-premiums paid as pre-tax dollars. short term disability, long term disability, paid vacation and sick time, CME time, and participation in a tax deferred annuity plan with employer contributions after one year of service. Based on AAPHC being deemed a Community Health Center, we also qualify for the Federal Torts Claims Act which allows providers free malpractice insurance.

Albany Area Primary Health Care, Inc. develops partnerships with our patients in the context of family and community. As a part of our commitment to providing quality care we are currently looking to expand our optometry team! Operating an integrated care model to our patients also offers a unique practice environment for our providers and allows them to go beyond the typical office environment and actually see patients where they are. We offer services inside of our School Based Health Centers, as well as offering services at our primary care offices.
AAPHC offers a competitive benefits package including health and dental-premiums paid as pre-tax dollars. short term disability, long term disability, paid vacation and sick time, CME time, and participation in a tax deferred annuity plan with employer contributions after one year of service. Based on AAPHC being deemed a Community Health Center, we also qualify for the Federal Torts Claims Act which allows providers free malpractice insurance.

Job Title: Optometrist - Full Time or Part Time
Job Description:
C. Distinctive Eyewear is a patient-centric optometry practice whose full focus is on providing the highest level of service and care to our patients. We are currently seeking an Optometrist who shares our same goals and would like to join our amazing team!
With a more relaxed pace and a flexible schedule, you'll be able to spend more time with your patients and find a happy work life balance at our independent practice. You'll also be able to practice full scope optometry and manage your patients' eye health using the latest technology, including Optos, OCT, and Low Level Light Therapy Dry Eye Treatment. Our staff is excited to welcome our next talented OD and will be there to assist in making your transition as comfortable as possible!
We offer a comprehensive benefits package, including:
Health Insurance

We are looking for an Optometrist to perform eye tests and provide excellent eye care to our patients. Optometrist responsibilities include analyzing vision tests, identifying sight problems and prescribing corrective lenses and eyeglasses. To be successful in this role, you should have attention to detail and be able to treat all kinds of patients with kindness and discretion, from young children to the elderly. Note that to be considered for this position, you need to be a licensed Optometrist. Ultimately, you will ensure the accurate diagnosis and treatment of eye diseases and injuries.
Responsibilities
Perform comprehensive eye and vision tests
Diagnose defects of the eye, such as myopia, astigmatism and glaucoma
Provide personalized temporary and permanent solutions to sight issues based on each patient’s specific case and medical history

We are looking for a full time Doctor of Optometry to join our two location group practice in the exceptional Dartmouth college region. Enjoy spectacular outdoor recreational options with all the amenities expected in an Ivy League setting: arts, entertainment, restaurants, great schools and medical center- all of which complement the beauty of Vermont and New Hampshire in the Connecticut River Valley- and only two hours from Boston.
Our two office locations, in White River Junction, Vermont and Hanover, New Hampshire, provide the most up to date eye care technologies and services for our patients. We enjoy an excellent working relationship with high level ophthalmology specialists in our region and participate in monthly Grand Round meetings at Dartmouth Hitchcock Medical Center. We support and encourage our doctors to pursue any specialty areas of interest such as: advanced contact lens work, pediatrics, low vision and progressive medical eye care management.
The position is for a four or five day, forty hour week (no weekends) with starting salary of $135K with full benefits: health and malpractice insurance, 401K, vacation/education time, all license fees and AOA and state association dues. Future partnership opportunities can be available.

POSITION SUMMARY: The Optometrist willprovide quality eye care and emergency treatment to Hometown (HHC) patients. The primary focus will be to examine eyes and visual system, diagnose problems or impairments, prescribe corrective lenses, and provide treatment. May prescribe therapeutic drugs to treat specific eye conditions. The optometrist will collaborate with HHC providers and support staff.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES
1. Perform vision tests, analyze results and develop a treatment plan
2. Examine eyes, using observation, instruments and pharmaceutical agents, to determine visual acuity and perception, focus and coordination and to diagnose diseases and other abnormalities such as glaucoma or color blindness.
3. Prescribe eyeglasses, contact lenses, and medications

Job Title: Optometrist: Give the Gift of Sight Both at Home and Abroad
Job Description:
Dr. Presley & Associates is a thriving optometry practice located in Tulsa and Sand Springs, Oklahoma. In recent years, we have experienced tremendous growth, thus we’re currently looking for an optometrist to help provide visual and eye health care to our patients. The schedule is very flexible and could consist of 2 to 5 days a week. This is a great opportunity to work with a knowledgeable staff as well as a dedicated scribe in a professional environment. This allows the Dr. to focus on patient care rather than data entry.
Dr. Presley & Associates is a fast paced environment, located next to Eyemart Express. We see approx. 30 patients per day and provide our doctors with compensation well above the Oklahoma average. In addition to helping patients in our local community, we allow both our staff and doctors the opportunity to participate in short term medical mission trips to impoverished countries. Over the past 3 years we’ve provided eye care and glasses to over 6,000 people in Kenya, Colombia and Ecuador.

Job Title: Optometrist: Give the Gift of Sight Both at Home and Abroad
Job Description:
Dr. Presley & Associates is a thriving optometry practice located in Tulsa and Sand Springs, Oklahoma. In recent years, we have experienced tremendous growth, thus we’re currently looking for an optometrist to help provide visual and eye health care to our patients. The schedule is very flexible and could consist of 2 to 5 days a week. This is a great opportunity to work with a knowledgeable staff as well as a dedicated scribe in a professional environment. This allows the Dr. to focus on patient care rather than data entry.
Dr. Presley & Associates is a fast paced environment, located next to Eyemart Express. We see approx. 30 patients per day and provide our doctors with compensation well above the Oklahoma average. In addition to helping patients in our local community, we allow both our staff and doctors the opportunity to participate in short term medical mission trips to impoverished countries. Over the past 3 years we’ve provided eye care and glasses to over 6,000 people in Kenya, Colombia and Ecuador.

Lifestyle Practice Opportunity
Busy surgical practice is seeking a full-time Optometrist to join our community-oriented, private practice located just south of the Twin Cities in Minnesota. The practice is seeking a compassionate, growth-oriented individual who desires to work in a collaborative group practice setting.
Richie Eye Clinic and LASIK Center specializes in providing comprehensive eye care services to its surrounding communities. Albany Area Primary Health Care, Inc. develops partnerships with our patients in the context of family and community. As a community health center it is our goal to offer a broad range of primary care services. We strive to provide comprehensive, coordinated, and continuous care to all who access our services. AAPHC is proud that all qualifying clinical locations operated by AAPHC are recognized Patient Centered Medical Homes by the National Center for Quality Assurance.
As a part of our commitment to providing quality care we are currently looking to expand our optometry team! Operating an integrated care model to our patients also offers a unique practice environment for our providers and allows them to go beyond the typical office environment and actually see patients where they are. We offer services inside of our School Based Health Centers, as well as offering services at our primary care offices.
AAPHC offers a competitive benefits package including health and dental-premiums paid as pre-tax dollars. short term disability, long term disability, paid vacation and sick time, CME time, and participation in a tax deferred annuity plan with employer contributions after one year of service. Based on AAPHC being deemed a Community Health Center, we also qualify for the Federal Torts Claims Act which allows providers free malpractice insurance.

The primary focus will be to examine eyes and visual system, diagnose problems or impairments, prescribe corrective lenses, and provide treatment. May prescribe therapeutic drugs to treat specific eye conditions. The optometrist will collaborate with HHC providers and support staff.

1. Perform vision tests, analyze results and develop a treatment plan
2. Examine eyes, using observation, instruments and pharmaceutical agents, to determine visual acuity and perception, focus and coordination and to diagnose diseases and other abnormalities such as glaucoma or color blindness.
3. Prescribe eyeglasses, contact lenses, and medications

Vision To Learn is a non-profit organization that provides free eye exams and free glasses to students in low-income communities to give them every chance to succeed in school and in life. The program was founded in Los Angeles in 2012 and has since expanded to schools throughout areas of California, Delaware, Hawaii, Iowa, Maryland, Michigan, New Jersey, Georgia, North Carolina, and Pennsylvania. 80% of all learning during a child’s first 12 years is obtained through vision and is consequently one of the most basic problems standing in the way of educational achievement. Since our inception, Vision To Learn examined over 285,000 students and provided over 227,000 children with free glasses. Vision To Learn partners with school districts to provide eye exams to children living in underserved communities with unmet needs for glasses. Our mobile eye clinics arrive at the school on a pre-scheduled date. We see an average of 20 students daily on our mobile clinic.
Position Description

POSITION SUMMARY: The Optometrist willprovide quality eye care and emergency treatment to Hometown (HHC) patients. The primary focus will be to examine eyes and visual system, diagnose problems or impairments, prescribe corrective lenses, and provide treatment. May prescribe therapeutic drugs to treat specific eye conditions. The optometrist will collaborate with HHC providers and support staff.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES
1. Perform vision tests, analyze results and develop a treatment plan
2. Examine eyes, using observation, instruments and pharmaceutical agents, to determine visual acuity and perception, focus and coordination and to diagnose diseases and other abnormalities such as glaucoma or color blindness.
3. Prescribe eyeglasses, contact lenses, and medications

It is the mission of Mobile Medical Support to maintain and improve the health of seniors by providing comprehensive Audiology, Dental, Podiatry, and Vision care. Our goal is to bring compassionate, age appropriate care to seniors. We strive towards these goals by serving our patients based on their needs, rather than their coverage while continuously setting new standards in the Nursing Home Industry by exceeding our patients and facilities expectations.
We are looking for an exceptional person to join our Vision team! The Optometrist is the face of the entire Vision department to their patients at nursing facilities, independent living facilities, and the PACE program. They manage the field team to ensure the patients receive the best and proper care possible and everything is done up to the correct standards. The Optometrist will also see patients to ensure that they are getting the results we expect.
Mobile Medical Support Vision proudly provides compassionate eyecare services to the underserved population throughout the state of Michigan. We pride ourselves on the exceptional treatment we provide to the patients under our care. To continue our great work, we need more Optometrists who are experienced, energetic, patient and kind in the Grand Rapids area. We offer an excellent source of income with a guaranteed daily rate, as well as providing you with some variety to your routine mode of practice. We look forward to talking to you soon!

Job Title: Optometrist - Full Time or Part Time
Job Description:
C. Distinctive Eyewear is a patient-centric optometry practice whose full focus is on providing the highest level of service and care to our patients. We are currently seeking an Optometrist who shares our same goals and would like to join our amazing team!
With a more relaxed pace and a flexible schedule, you'll be able to spend more time with your patients and find a happy work life balance at our independent practice. You'll also be able to practice full scope optometry and manage your patients' eye health using the latest technology, including Optos, OCT, and Low Level Light Therapy Dry Eye Treatment. Our staff is excited to welcome our next talented OD and will be there to assist in making your transition as comfortable as possible!

Health Insurance

Job Title: Optometrist: Give the Gift of Sight Both at Home and Abroad
Job Description:
Dr. Presley & Associates is a thriving optometry practice located in Tulsa and Sand Springs, Oklahoma. In recent years, we have experienced tremendous growth, thus we’re currently looking for an optometrist to help provide visual and eye health care to our patients. The schedule is very flexible and could consist of 2 to 5 days a week. This is a great opportunity to work with a knowledgeable staff as well as a dedicated scribe in a professional environment. This allows the Dr. to focus on patient care rather than data entry.
Dr. Presley & Associates is a fast paced environment, located next to Eyemart Express. We see approx. 30 patients per day and provide our doctors with compensation well above the Oklahoma average. In addition to helping patients in our local community, we allow both our staff and doctors the opportunity to participate in short term medical mission trips to impoverished countries. Over the past 3 years we’ve provided eye care and glasses to over 6,000 people in Kenya, Colombia and Ecuador.

ASSOCIATE Doctor of Optometry

Enjoy the balance of work and personal life in an area that offers year-round sun with majestic mountain views and palm trees. There are a multitude of amenities including golf, shopping, restaurants, music festivals and more. Once seen as a retirement oasis, the Coachella Valley has attracted young families and the area is seeing rapid growth and development.

Strong optometric clinical skills
Strong refractive skills, prism binocular testing and appropriate prescribing

Albany Area Primary Health Care, Inc. develops partnerships with our patients in the context of family and community. As a community health center it is our goal to offer a broad range of primary care services. We strive to provide comprehensive, coordinated, and continuous care to all who access our services. AAPHC is proud that all qualifying clinical locations operated by AAPHC are recognized Patient Centered Medical Homes by the National Center for Quality Assurance.
As a part of our commitment to providing quality care we are currently looking to expand our optometry team! Operating an integrated care model to our patients also offers a unique practice environment for our providers and allows them to go beyond the typical office environment and actually see patients where they are. We offer services inside of our School Based Health Centers, as well as offering services at our primary care offices.
AAPHC offers a competitive benefits package including health and dental-premiums paid as pre-tax dollars. short term disability, long term disability, paid vacation and sick time, CME time, and participation in a tax deferred annuity plan with employer contributions after one year of service. Based on AAPHC being deemed a Community Health Center, we also qualify for the Federal Torts Claims Act which allows providers free malpractice insurance.

Albany Area Primary Health Care, Inc

Company Name: Eyecare Vision Centers II- Eyecare Washington

Job Description:
We are looking for a COVID-19 vaccinated and OM certified Optometrist to perform eye tests and provide excellent eye care to our patients. Optometrist responsibilities include analyzing vision tests, identifying sight problems and prescribing corrective lenses and eyeglasses. To be successful in this role, you should have attention to detail and be able to treat all kinds of patients with kindness and discretion, from young children to the elderly. Note that to be considered for this position, you need to be a licensed Optometrist. Ultimately, you will ensure the accurate diagnosis and treatment of eye diseases and injuries.
Responsibilities
Perform comprehensive eye and vision tests
Diagnose defects of the eye, such as myopia, astigmatism and glaucoma
Provide personalized temporary and permanent solutions to sight issues based on each patient’s specific case and medical history

Job Title: PT Optometrist - Doylestown Pa: Flexible days/hours
Job Description:
Doylestown Family Eye Associates is a single lane medical optometry practice located in the heart of Bucks County, Pa. We have a fully integrated EMR system, Cirrus OCT, Zeiss Fundus photography, VF perimeter, an in-house lens edger and a full staff in place. We see about 15-20 patients per day and schedule every half hour. No weekends required and complete flexibility in terms of working M-Th and/or some combination. Docs will only see patients - no contact lens fittings, no billing, etc. It is a professional yet casual environment with a wonderful surrouding community.
We are family first here so it is the perfect place for someone looking to be part of a professional, award winning team (full time or part time) but also have a full home and social life. Come see Doylestown Family Eye Associates!!
Job Types: Part-time, Contract

Beyond 2020 Vision Specialists is looking for an associate Optometrist for part time work. We are a small 3 location practice located in Tampa, and Odessa FL. New graduates are welcomed! Clinical training for new grads will be given.
Pay ranges based on volume with a guaranteed minimum per day. Pay can reach upwards of $1,000 daily in the busiest of seasons.
We have Optos digital retinal imaging in every location along with slit lamp digital cameras to document anterior segment disease.
Our techs do all the pretesting for our doctors. Techs will do the in-lane prelims and scribe if needed.

Are you excited about the opportunity to ignite your career in the optometry field? Does the thought of working at a practice committed to making a difference in their community excite you? Great! This may be the practice for you!
Location
Located in sunny California, Coachella Valley Optometry proudly serves the Coachella community. With sunshine year round, it's no wonder we earned the nickname of “The City of Eternal Sunshine.” With rich Hispanic influences in the community, you can experience the heritage at our community events, local shops, or authentic restaurants. Our two office locations, in White River Junction, Vermont and Hanover, New Hampshire, provide the most up to date eye care technologies and services for our patients. We enjoy an excellent working relationship with high level ophthalmology specialists in our region and participate in monthly Grand Round meetings at Dartmouth Hitchcock Medical Center. We support and encourage our doctors to pursue any specialty areas of interest such as: advanced contact lens work, pediatrics, low vision and progressive medical eye care management.
The position is for a four or five day, forty hour week (no weekends) with starting salary of $135K with full benefits: health and malpractice insurance, 401K, vacation/education time, all license fees and AOA and state association dues. Future partnership opportunities can be available.

POSITION SUMMARY: The Optometrist willprovide quality eye care and emergency treatment to Hometown (HHC) patients. The primary focus will be to examine eyes and visual system, diagnose problems or impairments, prescribe corrective lenses, and provide treatment. May prescribe therapeutic drugs to treat specific eye conditions. The optometrist will collaborate with HHC providers and support staff.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES
1. Perform vision tests, analyze results and develop a treatment plan
2. Examine eyes, using observation, instruments and pharmaceutical agents, to determine visual acuity and perception, focus and coordination and to diagnose diseases and other abnormalities such as glaucoma or color blindness.
3. Prescribe eyeglasses, contact lenses, and medications

Seeking motivated and committed full-time optometrist for an exceptional eye care/ophthalmology practice opportunity
Will consider experienced physician or new graduate
Capabilities should include ocular disease and pathology, adult, pediatric and geriatric eye care, anterior and posterior segment disease, and contact and spectacle lenses

We are looking for an Optometrist to perform eye tests and provide excellent eye care to our patients. Optometrist responsibilities include analyzing vision tests, identifying sight problems and prescribing corrective lenses and eyeglasses. To be successful in this role, you should have attention to detail and be able to treat all kinds of patients with kindness and discretion, from young children to the elderly. Note that to be considered for this position, you need to be a licensed Optometrist. Ultimately, you will ensure the accurate diagnosis and treatment of eye diseases and injuries.
Responsibilities
Perform comprehensive eye and vision tests
Diagnose defects of the eye, such as myopia, astigmatism and glaucoma
Provide personalized temporary and permanent solutions to sight issues based on each patient’s specific case and medical history

Job Title: Optometrist: Give the Gift of Sight Both at Home and Abroad
Job Description:
Dr. Presley & Associates is a thriving optometry practice located in Tulsa and Sand Springs, Oklahoma. In recent years, we have experienced tremendous growth, thus we’re currently looking for an optometrist to help provide visual and eye health care to our patients. The schedule is very flexible and could consist of 2 to 5 days a week. This is a great opportunity to work with a knowledgeable staff as well as a dedicated scribe in a professional environment. This allows the Dr. to focus on patient care rather than data entry.
Dr. Presley & Associates is a fast paced environment, located next to Eyemart Express. We see approx. 30 patients per day and provide our doctors with compensation well above the Oklahoma average. In addition to helping patients in our local community, we allow both our staff and doctors the opportunity to participate in short term medical mission trips to impoverished countries. Over the past 3 years we’ve provided eye care and glasses to over 6,000 people in Kenya, Colombia and Ecuador.

Job Title: Optometrist - Full Time or Part Time
Job Description:
C. Distinctive Eyewear is a patient-centric optometry practice whose full focus is on providing the highest level of service and care to our patients. We are currently seeking an Optometrist who shares our same goals and would like to join our amazing team!
With a more relaxed pace and a flexible schedule, you'll be able to spend more time with your patients and find a happy work life balance at our independent practice. You'll also be able to practice full scope optometry and manage your patients' eye health using the latest technology, including Optos, OCT, and Low Level Light Therapy Dry Eye Treatment. Our staff is excited to welcome our next talented OD and will be there to assist in making your transition as comfortable as possible!
We offer a comprehensive benefits package, including:
Health Insurance

Grace Vision is a practice built on clinical excellence, outstanding patient experience and the latest in ophthalmic options.
Grace Vision is looking for excellent clinicians committed to patient care to join our practice. We practice full scope optometry and offer digital eye exam equipment along with Optomap, OCT and EHR. We see about 15-20 patients per day and schedule every half hour. No weekends required and complete flexibility in terms of working M-Th and/or some combination. Docs will only see patients - no contact lens fittings, no billing, etc. It is a professional yet casual environment with a wonderful surrouding community.
We are family first here so it is the perfect place for someone looking to be part of a professional, award winning team (full time or part time) but also have a full home and social life. Come see Doylestown Family Eye Associates!!

We support and encourage our doctors to pursue any specialty areas of interest such as: advanced contact lens work, pediatrics, low vision and progressive medical eye care management.
The position is for a four or five day, forty hour week (no weekends) with starting salary of $135K with full benefits: health and malpractice insurance, 401K, vacation/education time, all license fees and AOA and state association dues. Future partnership opportunities can be available.

Albany Area Primary Health Care, Inc. develops partnerships with our patients in the context of family and community. As a community health center it is our goal to offer a broad range of primary care services. We strive to provide comprehensive, coordinated, and continuous care to all who access our services. AAPHC is proud that all qualifying clinical locations operated by AAPHC are recognized Patient Centered Medical Homes by the National Center for Quality Assurance.
As a part of our commitment to providing quality care we are currently looking to expand our optometry team! Operating an integrated care model to our patients also offers a unique practice environment for our providers and allows them to go beyond the typical office environment and actually see patients where they are. We offer services inside of our School Based Health Centers, as well as offering services at our primary care offices.
AAPHC offers a competitive benefits package including health and dental-premiums paid as pre-tax dollars. short term disability, long term disability, paid vacation and sick time, CME time, and participation in a tax deferred annuity plan with employer contributions after one year of service. Based on AAPHC being deemed a Community Health Center, we also qualify for the Federal Torts Claims Act which allows providers free malpractice insurance.

About Vision To Learn
Vision To Learn is a non-profit organization that provides free eye exams and free glasses to students in low-income communities to give them every chance to succeed in school and in life. The program was founded in Los Angeles in 2012 and has since expanded to schools throughout areas of California, Delaware, Hawaii, Iowa, Maryland, Michigan, New Jersey, Georgia, North Carolina, and Pennsylvania. 80% of all learning during a child’s first 12 years is obtained through vision and is consequently one of the most basic problems standing in the way of educational achievement. Since our inception, Vision To Learn examined over 285,000 students and provided over 227,000 children with free glasses. Vision To Learn partners with school districts to provide eye exams to children living in underserved communities with unmet needs for glasses. Our mobile eye clinics arrive at the school on a pre-scheduled date. We see an average of 20 students daily on our mobile clinic.

Albany Area Primary Health Care, Inc. develops partnerships with our patients in the context of family and community. Job Description:
About Vision To Learn
Vision To Learn is a non-profit organization that provides free eye exams and free glasses to students in low-income communities to give them every chance to succeed in school and in life. The program was founded in Los Angeles in 2012 and has since expanded to schools throughout areas of California, Delaware, Hawaii, Iowa, Maryland, Michigan, New Jersey, Georgia, North Carolina, and Pennsylvania. 80% of all learning during a child’s first 12 years is obtained through vision and is consequently one of the most basic problems standing in the way of educational achievement. Since our inception, Vision To Learn examined over 285,000 students and provided over 227,000 children with free glasses. Vision To Learn partners with school districts to provide eye exams to children living in underserved communities with unmet needs for glasses. Our mobile eye clinics arrive at the school on a pre-scheduled date. We see an average of 20 students daily on our mobile clinic.

Job Title: Optometrist: Give the Gift of Sight Both at Home and Abroad
Job Description:
Dr. Presley & Associates is a thriving optometry practice located in Tulsa and Sand Springs, Oklahoma. In recent years, we have experienced tremendous growth, thus we’re currently looking for an optometrist to help provide visual and eye health care to our patients. The schedule is very flexible and could consist of 2 to 5 days a week. This is a great opportunity to work with a knowledgeable staff as well as a dedicated scribe in a professional environment. This allows the Dr. to focus on patient care rather than data entry.
Dr. Presley & Associates is a fast paced environment, located next to Eyemart Express. We see approx. 30 patients per day and provide our doctors with compensation well above the Oklahoma average. In addition to helping patients in our local community, we allow both our staff and doctors the opportunity to participate in short term medical mission trips to impoverished countries. Over the past 3 years we’ve provided eye care and glasses to over 6,000 people in Kenya, Colombia and Ecuador.

Beyond 2020 Vision Specialists is looking for an associate Optometrist for part time work. We are a small 3 location practice located in Tampa, and Odessa FL. Ideal candidate would be an outgoing energetic Optometrist who wants to work part time with the possibility to eventually come aboard full time.
New graduates are welcomed! Clinical training for new grads will be given.
Pay ranges based on volume with a guaranteed minimum per day. Pay can reach upwards of $1,000 daily in the busiest of seasons.
We have Optos digital retinal imaging in every location along with slit lamp digital cameras to document anterior segment disease.
Our techs do all the pretesting for our doctors. Techs will do the in-lane prelims and scribe if needed.

Bishop, CA
Description
Toiyabe Indian Health Clinic is seeking a full-time Optometrist to join our dedicated team and play an integral role in helping to provide high-quality, compassionate care to patients in the native communities that we serve.
Qualifications:

We are looking for an Optometrist to perform eye tests and provide excellent eye care to our patients. Optometrist responsibilities include analyzing vision tests, identifying sight problems and prescribing corrective lenses and eyeglasses. To be successful in this role, you should have attention to detail and be able to treat all kinds of patients with kindness and discretion, from young children to the elderly. Note that to be considered for this position, you need to be a licensed Optometrist. Ultimately, you will ensure the accurate diagnosis and treatment of eye diseases and injuries.
Responsibilities
Perform comprehensive eye and vision tests
Diagnose defects of the eye, such as myopia, astigmatism and glaucoma
Provide personalized temporary and permanent solutions to sight issues based on each patient’s specific case and medical history

We are looking for a full time Doctor of Optometry to join our two location group practice in the exceptional Dartmouth college region. Enjoy spectacular outdoor recreational options with all the amenities expected in an Ivy League setting: arts, entertainment, restaurants, great schools and medical center- all of which complement the beauty of Vermont and New Hampshire in the Connecticut River Valley- and only two hours from Boston.
Our two office locations, in White River Junction, Vermont and Hanover, New Hampshire, provide the most up to date eye care technologies and services for our patients. We enjoy an excellent working relationship with high level ophthalmology specialists in our region and participate in monthly Grand Round meetings at Dartmouth Hitchcock Medical Center. We support and encourage our doctors to pursue any specialty areas of interest such as: advanced contact lens work, pediatrics, low vision and progressive medical eye care management.
The position is for a four or five day, forty hour week (no weekends) with starting salary of $135K with full benefits: health and malpractice insurance, 401K, vacation/education time, all license fees and AOA and state association dues. Future partnership opportunities can be available.

Position Overview
Are you excited about the opportunity to ignite your career in the optometry field? Does the thought of working at a practice committed to making a difference in their community excite you? Great! This may be the practice for you!
Location
Located in sunny California, Coachella Valley Optometry proudly serves the Coachella community. With sunshine year round, it's no wonder we earned the nickname of “The City of Eternal Sunshine.” With rich Hispanic influences in the community, you can experience the heritage at our community events, local shops, or authentic restaurants. We have highly skilled technical support and are located next to LensCrafters where the latest in lens technology is available to our patients. We serve patients in the Columbus area and offer routine and well as medical eye evaluations. We are proud to offer specialty contact lenses and provide Dry Eye Services. Albany Area Primary Health Care, Inc. develops partnerships with our patients in the context of family and community. AAPHC offers a competitive benefits package including health and dental-premiums paid as pre-tax dollars. short term disability, long term disability, paid vacation and sick time, CME time, and participation in a tax deferred annuity plan with employer contributions after one year of service. Based on AAPHC being deemed a Community Health Center, we also qualify for the Federal Torts Claims Act which allows providers free malpractice insurance.

Perspective Optometry is seeking to hire a passionate Doctor of Optometry in the Greater Palm Springs Area. PRIMARY PURPOSE
Optometrists provide comprehensive vision care to patients of all ages. This includes, but is not limited to prescribing, coordinating and dispensing eyeglasses. Optometrists coordinate the care of chronic eye conditions, needed annual screenings and acute eye care needs.

Must have a Doctor of Optometry degree from an accredited optometry school.
Must be licensed in the State of Ohio and meet all requirements for credentialing and privileging.
Must maintain appropriate continuing education requirements.
Must have BLS certification.

Job Title: Optometrist: Give the Gift of Sight Both at Home and Abroad
Job Description:
Dr. Presley & Associates is a thriving optometry practice located in Tulsa and Sand Springs, Oklahoma. In recent years, we have experienced tremendous growth, thus we’re currently looking for an optometrist to help provide visual and eye health care to our patients. The schedule is very flexible and could consist of 2 to 5 days a week. This is a great opportunity to work with a knowledgeable staff as well as a dedicated scribe in a professional environment. This allows the Dr. to focus on patient care rather than data entry.
Dr. Presley & Associates is a fast paced environment, located next to Eyemart Express. We see approx. 30 patients per day and provide our doctors with compensation well above the Oklahoma average. In addition to helping patients in our local community, we allow both our staff and doctors the opportunity to participate in short term medical mission trips to impoverished countries. Over the past 3 years we’ve provided eye care and glasses to over 6,000 people in Kenya, Colombia and Ecuador.

PRIMARY PURPOSE
Optometrists provide comprehensive vision care to patients of all ages. This includes, but is not limited to prescribing, coordinating and dispensing eyeglasses. Optometrists coordinate the care of chronic eye conditions, needed annual screenings and acute eye care needs.
EDUCATION AND CERTIFICATION REQUIREMENTS
Must have a Doctor of Optometry degree from an accredited optometry school.
Must be licensed in the State of Ohio and meet all requirements for credentialing and privileging.
Must maintain appropriate continuing education requirements.
Must have BLS certification.

Job Title: PT Optometrist - Doylestown Pa: Flexible days/hours
Job Description:
Doylestown Family Eye Associates is a single lane medical optometry practice located in the heart of Bucks County, Pa. We have a fully integrated EMR system, Cirrus OCT, Zeiss Fundus photography, VF perimeter, an in-house lens edger and a full staff in place. We see about 15-20 patients per day and schedule every half hour. No weekends required and complete flexibility in terms of working M-Th and/or some combination. Docs will only see patients - no contact lens fittings, no billing, etc. It is a professional yet casual environment with a wonderful surrouding community.
We are family first here so it is the perfect place for someone looking to be part of a professional, award winning team (full time or part time) but also have a full home and social life. Come see Doylestown Family Eye Associates!!

About us
Grace Vision is a practice built on clinical excellence, outstanding patient experience and the latest in ophthalmic options.

We are looking for a full time Doctor of Optometry to join our two location group practice in the exceptional Dartmouth college region. Enjoy spectacular outdoor recreational options with all the amenities expected in an Ivy League setting: arts, entertainment, restaurants, great schools and medical center- all of which complement the beauty of Vermont and New Hampshire in the Connecticut River Valley- and only two hours from Boston.
Our two office locations, in White River Junction, Vermont and Hanover, New Hampshire, provide the most up to date eye care technologies and services for our patients. We enjoy an excellent working relationship with high level ophthalmology specialists in our region and participate in monthly Grand Round meetings at Dartmouth Hitchcock Medical Center. We support and encourage our doctors to pursue any specialty areas of interest such as: advanced contact lens work, pediatrics, low vision and progressive medical eye care management.
The position is for a four or five day, forty hour week (no weekends) with starting salary of $135K with full benefits: health and malpractice insurance, 401K, vacation/education time, all license fees and AOA and state association dues. Future partnership opportunities can be available.

Albany Area Primary Health Care, Inc. develops partnerships with our patients in the context of family and community. As a community health center it is our goal to offer a broad range of primary care services. We strive to provide comprehensive, coordinated, and continuous care to all who access our services. AAPHC is proud that all qualifying clinical locations operated by AAPHC are recognized Patient Centered Medical Homes by the National Center for Quality Assurance.
As a part of our commitment to providing quality care we are currently looking to expand our optometry team! Operating an integrated care model to our patients also offers a unique practice environment for our providers and allows them to go beyond the typical office environment and actually see patients where they are. We offer services inside of our School Based Health Centers, as well as offering services at our primary care offices.
AAPHC offers a competitive benefits package including health and dental-premiums paid as pre-tax dollars. short term disability, long term disability, paid vacation and sick time, CME time, and participation in a tax deferred annuity plan with employer contributions after one year of service. Based on AAPHC being deemed a Community Health Center, we also qualify for the Federal Torts Claims Act which allows providers free malpractice insurance.

Albany Area Primary Health Care, Inc. develops partnerships with our patients in the context of family and community. As a part of our commitment to providing quality care we are currently looking to expand our optometry team! Operating an integrated care model to our patients also offers a unique practice environment for our providers and allows them to go beyond the typical office environment and actually see patients where they are. AAPHC offers a competitive benefits package including health and dental-premiums paid as pre-tax dollars. short term disability, long term disability, paid vacation and sick time, CME time, and participation in a tax deferred annuity plan with employer contributions after one year of service. Based on AAPHC being deemed a Community Health Center, we also qualify for the Federal Torts Claims Act which allows providers free malpractice insurance.

Job Title: Optometrist - Full Time or Part Time
Job Description:
C. Distinctive Eyewear is a patient-centric optometry practice whose full focus is on providing the highest level of service and care to our patients. We are currently seeking an Optometrist who shares our same goals and would like to join our amazing team!
With a more relaxed pace and a flexible schedule, you'll be able to spend more time with your patients and find a happy work life balance at our independent practice. You'll also be able to practice full scope optometry and manage your patients' eye health using the latest technology, including Optos, OCT, and Low Level Light Therapy Dry Eye Treatment. Our staff is excited to welcome our next talented OD and will be there to assist in making your transition as comfortable as possible!
We offer a comprehensive benefits package, including:
Health Insurance

Optometrist- Full/Part Time- Tallahassee
Join an established, doctor led, multi-location and rapidly-growing practice.

Work with fellow professionals who prioritize patient care
Competitive compensation package
Bonuses include production, retention and sign-on = great income potential
Practice Optometry and Eye Care in a professional setting
New grads and experienced ODs welcome!

We are looking for an Optometrist to perform eye tests and provide excellent eye care to our patients. Optometrist responsibilities include analyzing vision tests, identifying sight problems and prescribing corrective lenses and eyeglasses. To be successful in this role, you should have attention to detail and be able to treat all kinds of patients with kindness and discretion, from young children to the elderly. Note that to be considered for this position, you need to be a licensed Optometrist. Ultimately, you will ensure the accurate diagnosis and treatment of eye diseases and injuries.
Responsibilities
Perform comprehensive eye and vision tests
Diagnose defects of the eye, such as myopia, astigmatism and glaucoma
Provide personalized temporary and permanent solutions to sight issues based on each patient’s specific case and medical history

Job Title: Optometrist: Give the Gift of Sight Both at Home and Abroad
Job Description:
Dr. Presley & Associates is a thriving optometry practice located in Tulsa and Sand Springs, Oklahoma. In recent years, we have experienced tremendous growth, thus we’re currently looking for an optometrist to help provide visual and eye health care to our patients. The schedule is very flexible and could consist of 2 to 5 days a week. This is a great opportunity to work with a knowledgeable staff as well as a dedicated scribe in a professional environment. This allows the Dr. to focus on patient care rather than data entry.
Dr. Presley & Associates is a fast paced environment, located next to Eyemart Express. We see approx. 30 patients per day and provide our doctors with compensation well above the Oklahoma average. In addition to helping patients in our local community, we allow both our staff and doctors the opportunity to participate in short term medical mission trips to impoverished countries. Over the past 3 years we’ve provided eye care and glasses to over 6,000 people in Kenya, Colombia and Ecuador.

PRIMARY PURPOSE
Optometrists provide comprehensive vision care to patients of all ages. This includes, but is not limited to prescribing, coordinating and dispensing eyeglasses. Optometrists coordinate the care of chronic eye conditions, needed annual screenings and acute eye care needs.
EDUCATION AND CERTIFICATION REQUIREMENTS
Must have a Doctor of Optometry degree from an accredited optometry school.
Must be licensed in the State of Ohio and meet all requirements for credentialing and privileging.
Must maintain appropriate continuing education requirements.
Must have BLS certification.

Job Title: PT Optometrist - Doylestown Pa: Flexible days/hours
Job Description:
Doylestown Family Eye Associates is a single lane medical optometry practice located in the heart of Bucks County, Pa. We have a fully integrated EMR system, Cirrus OCT, Zeiss Fundus photography, VF perimeter, an in-house lens edger and a full staff in place. We see about 15-20 patients per day and schedule every half hour. No weekends required and complete flexibility in terms of working M-Th and/or some combination. Docs will only see patients - no contact lens fittings, no billing, etc. It is a professional yet casual environment with a wonderful surrouding community.
We are family first here so it is the perfect place for someone looking to be part of a professional, award winning team (full time or part time) but also have a full home and social life. Come see Doylestown Family Eye Associates!!
Job Types: Part-time, Contract

About us
Grace Vision is a practice built on clinical excellence, outstanding patient experience and the latest in ophthalmic options.
Grace Vision is looking for excellent clinicians committed to patient care to join our practice. We practice full scope optometry and offer digital eye exam equipment along with Optomap, OCT and EHR. We have highly skilled technical support and are located next to LensCrafters where the latest in lens technology is available to our patients. We serve patients in the Columbus area and offer routine and well as medical eye evaluations. We are proud to offer specialty contact lenses and provide Dry Eye Services. We offer competitive salary, production bonus and many other benefits. Relocation Stipend may be available. Send a CV to learn more about joining our practice.

We are looking for a full time Doctor of Optometry to join our two location group practice in the exceptional Dartmouth college region. Enjoy spectacular outdoor recreational options with all the amenities expected in an Ivy League setting: arts, entertainment, restaurants, great schools and medical center- all of which complement the beauty of Vermont and New Hampshire in the Connecticut River Valley- and only two hours from Boston.
Our two office locations, in White River Junction, Vermont and Hanover, New Hampshire, provide the most up to date eye care technologies and services for our patients. We enjoy an excellent working relationship with high level ophthalmology specialists in our region and participate in monthly Grand Round meetings at Dartmouth Hitchcock Medical Center. We support and encourage our doctors to pursue any specialty areas of interest such as: advanced contact lens work, pediatrics, low vision and progressive medical eye care management.
The position is for a four or five day, forty hour week (no weekends) with starting salary of $135K with full benefits: health and malpractice insurance, 401K, vacation/education time, all license fees and AOA and state association dues. Future partnership opportunities can be available.

Job Summary
Position Overview
Are you excited about the opportunity to ignite your career in the optometry field? Does the thought of working at a practice committed to making a difference in their community excite you? Great! This may be the practice for you!
Location
Located in sunny California, Coachella Valley Optometry proudly serves the Coachella community. With sunshine year round, it's no wonder we earned the nickname of “The City of Eternal Sunshine.” With rich Hispanic influences in the community, you can experience the heritage at our community events, local shops, or authentic restaurants. Take a stroll downtown to celebrate the city’s history and people, and admire the local art work. Looking for a fun night out, we are home to two high-stake casino properties. Whether it is indoors or outdoors, there is something for everyone to experience and enjoy!

We are proud to maintain our family business; and people love our classy, casual, comfortable home-like surroundings!
Please contact Sarah for more information, and include resume & references.
Thank you!

Enjoy spectacular outdoor recreational options with all the amenities expected in an Ivy League setting: arts, entertainment, restaurants, great schools and medical center- all of which complement the beauty of Vermont and New Hampshire in the Connecticut River Valley- and only two hours from Boston.
Our two office locations, in White River Junction, Vermont and Hanover, New Hampshire, provide the most up to date eye care technologies and services for our patients. We enjoy an excellent working relationship with high level ophthalmology specialists in our region and participate in monthly Grand Round meetings at Dartmouth Hitchcock Medical Center. We support and encourage our doctors to pursue any specialty areas of interest such as: advanced contact lens work, pediatrics, low vision and progressive medical eye care management.
The position is for a four or five day, forty hour week (no weekends) with starting salary of $135K with full benefits: health and malpractice insurance, 401K, vacation/education time, all license fees and AOA and state association dues. Future partnership opportunities can be available.

Albany Area Primary Health Care, Inc. develops partnerships with our patients in the context of family and community. Job Description:
C. Distinctive Eyewear is a patient-centric optometry practice whose full focus is on providing the highest level of service and care to our patients. We are currently seeking an Optometrist who shares our same goals and would like to join our amazing team!
With a more relaxed pace and a flexible schedule, you'll be able to spend more time with your patients and find a happy work life balance at our independent practice. You'll also be able to practice full scope optometry and manage your patients' eye health using the latest technology, including Optos, OCT, and Low Level Light Therapy Dry Eye Treatment. Our staff is excited to welcome our next talented OD and will be there to assist in making your transition as comfortable as possible!

Health Insurance

Competitive compensation package

New grads and experienced ODs welcome!

We are looking for an Optometrist to perform eye tests and provide excellent eye care to our patients. Optometrist responsibilities include analyzing vision tests, identifying sight problems and prescribing corrective lenses and eyeglasses. To be successful in this role, you should have attention to detail and be able to treat all kinds of patients with kindness and discretion, from young children to the elderly. Note that to be considered for this position, you need to be a licensed Optometrist. Ultimately, you will ensure the accurate diagnosis and treatment of eye diseases and injuries.
Responsibilities
Perform comprehensive eye and vision tests
Diagnose defects of the eye, such as myopia, astigmatism and glaucoma
Provide personalized temporary and permanent solutions to sight issues based on each patient’s specific case and medical history

Job Title: Optometrist: Give the Gift of Sight Both at Home and Abroad
Job Description:
Dr. Presley & Associates is a thriving optometry practice located in Tulsa and Sand Springs, Oklahoma. In recent years, we have experienced tremendous growth, thus we’re currently looking for an optometrist to help provide visual and eye health care to our patients. The schedule is very flexible and could consist of 2 to 5 days a week. This is a great opportunity to work with a knowledgeable staff as well as a dedicated scribe in a professional environment. This allows the Dr. to focus on patient care rather than data entry.
Dr. Presley & Associates is a fast paced environment, located next to Eyemart Express. We see approx. 30 patients per day and provide our doctors with compensation well above the Oklahoma average. In addition to helping patients in our local community, we allow both our staff and doctors the opportunity to participate in short term medical mission trips to impoverished countries. Over the past 3 years we’ve provided eye care and glasses to over 6,000 people in Kenya, Colombia and Ecuador.

PRIMARY PURPOSE
Optometrists provide comprehensive vision care to patients of all ages. This includes, but is not limited to prescribing, coordinating and dispensing eyeglasses. Optometrists coordinate the care of chronic eye conditions, needed annual screenings and acute eye care needs.
EDUCATION AND CERTIFICATION REQUIREMENTS
Must have a Doctor of Optometry degree from an accredited optometry school.
Must be licensed in the State of Ohio and meet all requirements for credentialing and privileging.
Must maintain appropriate continuing education requirements.
Must have BLS certification.

Job Title: PT Optometrist - Doylestown Pa: Flexible days/hours
Job Description:
Doylestown Family Eye Associates is a single lane medical optometry practice located in the heart of Bucks County, Pa. We have a fully integrated EMR system, Cirrus OCT, Zeiss Fundus photography, VF perimeter, an in-house lens edger and a full staff in place. We see about 15-20 patients per day and schedule every half hour. No weekends required and complete flexibility in terms of working M-Th and/or some combination. Docs will only see patients - no contact lens fittings, no billing, etc. It is a professional yet casual environment with a wonderful surrouding community.
We are family first here so it is the perfect place for someone looking to be part of a professional, award winning team (full time or part time) but also have a full home and social life. Come see Doylestown Family Eye Associates!!
Job Types: Part-time, Contract

Doylestown Family Eye Associates is a single lane medical optometry practice located in the heart of Bucks County, Pa. We have a fully integrated EMR system, Cirrus OCT, Zeiss Fundus photography, VF perimeter, an in-house lens edger and a full staff in place. We see about 15-20 patients per day and schedule every half hour. No weekends required and complete flexibility in terms of working M-Th and/or some combination. Docs will only see patients - no contact lens fittings, no billing, etc. It is a professional yet casual environment with a wonderful surrouding community.
We are family first here so it is the perfect place for someone looking to be part of a professional, award winning team (full time or part time) but also have a full home and social life. Come see Doylestown Family Eye Associates!!
Job Types: Part-time, Contract

Our Vision is to be the best choice for healthcare in our community
Looking for a licensed Optometrist. If you love working with patients and providing excellent care this is the position for you!
Monday through Friday hours. NO evenings or weekends!
Position:
Optometrist

ASAP

We are looking for a licensed optometrist to work one day a week at Montecito Optometry performing eye exams, contact lens fittings, and medical visits. This person will work with onsite opticians to deliver friendly eye care and a great experience. A good bedside manner and a kind attitude go a long way in Montecito and we want a doctor that can make the patient feel confident that they are getting the best care. The work day would either be a Tuesday, Thursday, or Friday, with Friday being preferred.'

Job Type: Part-time

We are looking for an Optometrist to perform eye tests and provide excellent eye care to our patients. Optometrist responsibilities include analyzing vision tests, identifying sight problems and prescribing corrective lenses and eyeglasses. To be successful in this role, you should have attention to detail and be able to treat all kinds of patients with kindness and discretion, from young children to the elderly. Note that to be considered for this position, you need to be a licensed Optometrist. Ultimately, you will ensure the accurate diagnosis and treatment of eye diseases and injuries.
Responsibilities
Perform comprehensive eye and vision tests
Diagnose defects of the eye, such as myopia, astigmatism and glaucoma
Provide personalized temporary and permanent solutions to sight issues based on each patient’s specific case and medical history

Perspective Optometry is seeking to hire a passionate Doctor of Optometry in the Greater Palm Springs Area. Enjoy the balance of work and personal life in an area that offers year-round sun with majestic mountain views and palm trees. There are a multitude of amenities including golf, shopping, restaurants, music festivals and more. About us
Grace Vision is a practice built on clinical excellence, outstanding patient experience and the latest in ophthalmic options.
Grace Vision is looking for excellent clinicians committed to patient care to join our practice. We practice full scope optometry and offer digital eye exam equipment along with Optomap, OCT and EHR. We have highly skilled technical support and are located next to LensCrafters where the latest in lens technology is available to our patients. We serve patients in the Columbus area and offer routine and well as medical eye evaluations. We are proud to offer specialty contact lenses and provide Dry Eye Services. We offer competitive salary, production bonus and many other benefits. Relocation Stipend may be available. Send a CV to learn more about joining our practice.

We are looking for a full time Doctor of Optometry to join our two location group practice in the exceptional Dartmouth college region. Enjoy spectacular outdoor recreational options with all the amenities expected in an Ivy League setting: arts, entertainment, restaurants, great schools and medical center- all of which complement the beauty of Vermont and New Hampshire in the Connecticut River Valley- and only two hours from Boston.
Our two office locations, in White River Junction, Vermont and Hanover, New Hampshire, provide the most up to date eye care technologies and services for our patients. We enjoy an excellent working relationship with high level ophthalmology specialists in our region and participate in monthly Grand Round meetings at Dartmouth Hitchcock Medical Center. We support and encourage our doctors to pursue any specialty areas of interest such as: advanced contact lens work, pediatrics, low vision and progressive medical eye care management.
The position is for a four or five day, forty hour week (no weekends) with starting salary of $135K with full benefits: health and malpractice insurance, 401K, vacation/education time, all license fees and AOA and state association dues. Future partnership opportunities can be available.

Job Summary
Position Overview
Are you excited about the opportunity to ignite your career in the optometry field? Does the thought of working at a practice committed to making a difference in their community excite you? Great! This may be the practice for you!
Location
Located in sunny California, Coachella Valley Optometry proudly serves the Coachella community. With sunshine year round, it's no wonder we earned the nickname of “The City of Eternal Sunshine.” With rich Hispanic influences in the community, you can experience the heritage at our community events, local shops, or authentic restaurants. Take a stroll downtown to celebrate the city’s history and people, and admire the local art work. Looking for a fun night out, we are home to two high-stake casino properties. Whether it is indoors or outdoors, there is something for everyone to experience and enjoy!

In search of an experienced OD to examine patients in our high-end optical shop in bountiful suburban neighborhoods, West of I-95, North of I-90.
We have been serving this community since 1975, and have cultivated an extremely loyal, appreciative clientele and patient base.
We are proud to maintain our family business; and people love our classy, casual, comfortable home-like surroundings!
Please contact Sarah for more information, and include resume & references.
Thank you!

Rochester Eye Care Associates, PLLC is a forty-five-year-old practice with strong connections to our community, state-of-the-art equipment and friendly support staff. Albany Area Primary Health Care, Inc. develops partnerships with our patients in the context of family and community. As a community health center it is our goal to offer a broad range of primary care services. We strive to provide comprehensive, coordinated, and continuous care to all who access our services. AAPHC is proud that all qualifying clinical locations operated by AAPHC are recognized Patient Centered Medical Homes by the National Center for Quality Assurance.
As a part of our commitment to providing quality care we are currently looking to expand our optometry team! Operating an integrated care model to our patients also offers a unique practice environment for our providers and allows them to go beyond the typical office environment and actually see patients where they are. We offer services inside of our School Based Health Centers, as well as offering services at our primary care offices.
AAPHC offers a competitive benefits package including health and dental-premiums paid as pre-tax dollars. short term disability, long term disability, paid vacation and sick time, CME time, and participation in a tax deferred annuity plan with employer contributions after one year of service. Based on AAPHC being deemed a Community Health Center, we also qualify for the Federal Torts Claims Act which allows providers free malpractice insurance.
Company Name:
Albany Area Primary Health Care, Inc

Beyond 2020 Vision Specialists is looking for an associate Optometrist for part time work. We are a small 3 location practice located in Tampa, and Odessa FL. Ideal candidate would be an outgoing energetic Optometrist who wants to work part time with the possibility to eventually come aboard full time.
New graduates are welcomed! Clinical training for new grads will be given.
Pay ranges based on volume with a guaranteed minimum per day. Pay can reach upwards of $1,000 daily in the busiest of seasons.
We have Optos digital retinal imaging in every location along with slit lamp digital cameras to document anterior segment disease.
Our techs do all the pretesting for our doctors. Techs will do the in-lane prelims and scribe if needed.

Job Title: Optometrist: Give the Gift of Sight Both at Home and Abroad
Job Description:
Dr. Presley & Associates is a thriving optometry practice located in Tulsa and Sand Springs, Oklahoma. In recent years, we have experienced tremendous growth, thus we’re currently looking for an optometrist to help provide visual and eye health care to our patients. The schedule is very flexible and could consist of 2 to 5 days a week. This is a great opportunity to work with a knowledgeable staff as well as a dedicated scribe in a professional environment. This allows the Dr. to focus on patient care rather than data entry.
Dr. Presley & Associates is a fast paced environment, located next to Eyemart Express. We see approx. 30 patients per day and provide our doctors with compensation well above the Oklahoma average. In addition to helping patients in our local community, we allow both our staff and doctors the opportunity to participate in short term medical mission trips to impoverished countries. Over the past 3 years we’ve provided eye care and glasses to over 6,000 people in Kenya, Colombia and Ecuador.

PRIMARY PURPOSE
Optometrists provide comprehensive vision care to patients of all ages. This includes, but is not limited to prescribing, coordinating and dispensing eyeglasses. Optometrists coordinate the care of chronic eye conditions, needed annual screenings and acute eye care needs.
EDUCATION AND CERTIFICATION REQUIREMENTS
Must have a Doctor of Optometry degree from an accredited optometry school.
Must be licensed in the State of Ohio and meet all requirements for credentialing and privileging.
Must maintain appropriate continuing education requirements.
Must have BLS certification.

We are looking for an Optometrist to perform eye tests and provide excellent eye care to our patients. Optometrist responsibilities include analyzing vision tests, identifying sight problems and prescribing corrective lenses and eyeglasses. To be successful in this role, you should have attention to detail and be able to treat all kinds of patients with kindness and discretion, from young children to the elderly. Note that to be considered for this position, you need to be a licensed Optometrist. Ultimately, you will ensure the accurate diagnosis and treatment of eye diseases and injuries.
Responsibilities
Perform comprehensive eye and vision tests
Diagnose defects of the eye, such as myopia, astigmatism and glaucoma
Provide personalized temporary and permanent solutions to sight issues based on each patient’s specific case and medical history

Job Title: Optometrist: Give the Gift of Sight Both at Home and Abroad
Job Description:
Dr. Presley & Associates is a thriving optometry practice located in Tulsa and Sand Springs, Oklahoma. In recent years, we have experienced tremendous growth, thus we’re currently looking for an optometrist to help provide visual and eye health care to our patients. The schedule is very flexible and could consist of 2 to 5 days a week. This is a great opportunity to work with a knowledgeable staff as well as a dedicated scribe in a professional environment. This allows the Dr. to focus on patient care rather than data entry.
Dr. Presley & Associates is a fast paced environment, located next to Eyemart Express. We see approx. 30 patients per day and provide our doctors with compensation well above the Oklahoma average. In addition to helping patients in our local community, we allow both our staff and doctors the opportunity to participate in short term medical mission trips to impoverished countries. Over the past 3 years we’ve provided eye care and glasses to over 6,000 people in Kenya, Colombia and Ecuador.

PRIMARY PURPOSE
Optometrists provide comprehensive vision care to patients of all ages. This includes, but is not limited to prescribing, coordinating and dispensing eyeglasses. Optometrists coordinate the care of chronic eye conditions, needed annual screenings and acute eye care needs.
EDUCATION AND CERTIFICATION REQUIREMENTS
Must have a Doctor of Optometry degree from an accredited optometry school.
Must be licensed in the State of Ohio and meet all requirements for credentialing and privileging.
Must maintain appropriate continuing education requirements.
Must have BLS certification.

Job Title: PT Optometrist - Doylestown Pa: Flexible days/hours
Job Description:
Doylestown Family Eye Associates is a single lane medical optometry practice located in the heart of Bucks County, Pa. We have a fully integrated EMR system, Cirrus OCT, Zeiss Fundus photography, VF perimeter, an in-house lens edger and a full staff in place. We see about 15-20 patients per day and schedule every half hour. No weekends required and complete flexibility in terms of working M-Th and/or some combination. Docs will only see patients - no contact lens fittings, no billing, etc. It is a professional yet casual environment with a wonderful surrouding community.
We are family first here so it is the perfect place for someone looking to be part of a professional, award winning team (full time or part time) but also have a full home and social life. Come see Doylestown Family Eye Associates!!
